category: Member city/provincial sports association regulations/Article 14 (Convocation of general meeting)
contents: Article 14 (Convocation of general meeting) ① The regular general meeting of the city/provincial sports council shall be convened by the president within two months after the end of each fiscal year. Revised April 29, 2016, May 15, 2017. [Moved from Article 13 February 4, 2021] ② The extraordinary general meeting shall be convened by the chairman within 15 days in any of the following cases. Revised 2021. 2. 4. 1. When the Chairman deems it necessary 2. When the majority of registered directors request a convocation by presenting the purpose of the meeting 3. When more than one-third of registered delegates present the purpose of the meeting and convene it 4. When the auditor requests a convening pursuant to Article 28, Paragraph 4, Item 4. ③ Notwithstanding the provisions of Paragraph 2, Items 2 through 4, the Chairman fails to convene a general meeting within 15 days without justifiable grounds. In other cases, the general meeting may be convened by the director, representative, or auditor who requested the convocation. Revised on March 23, 2017, October 6, 2021, and May 10, 2022. ④ The general meeting shall be convened in writing (including electronic documents) by clearly recording the agenda, date, and location at least 7 days prior to the meeting. must be notified to. However, if there are urgent reasons, the period may be shortened. Revised March 23, 2017. ⑤ The general meeting can only decide on notified agenda items. However, if there is the approval of all delegates present, other items may also be proposed and voted on. Revised May 10, 2022. ⑥ The general meeting cannot be replaced by a written resolution. However, the proviso to paragraph 7 is an exception. Revised May 10, 2022. ⑦ The general meeting shall be held face-to-face in principle. However, if it is difficult to conduct a face-to-face meeting due to special circumstances such as infectious diseases or natural disasters, deliberation and resolution may be made through remote communication means or submission of written resolutions, and the necessary matters shall be determined separately. In this case, agenda items requiring closed or anonymous voting cannot be voted on. Newly established 2021. 10. 6.
